Description: Struck bronze medal; in original box. (whole)

A woman to left, wearing a long dress, her hair up, her feet bare, seated in profile to right, plays a piano, while another woman, similarly attired, standing on her far side, her body almost to front, her head in profile to right, holds up a book and sings; to right, against the side of the piano, a cello and a trombone, entwined with a laurel branch. (obverse)

Central roundel, in a circular border, with to left a standing female figure, draped, who leans her left forearm against the edge of the roundel and holds a mask with an open mouth in her right hand, to right three stringed instruments entwined with the leavesof a palm branch, above the roundel, two masks and in the exergue, a cartouche. (reverse)
Producer name: Die Engraved or Modelled for Reducing Machine: Adolphe Rivet
Curator's comments: The lining of the box's lid is stamped: 'LE "MÉDAILLIER" / PARIS / 13, RUE DU CONSERVATOIRE'. For another medal by Rivet, smaller and in silve,r with the same design on the reverse, apart from the insert roundel, which has the coat-of arms of Algiers and 'ALGER', see 1978,0712.42.
